content:
Hello! I am currently working toward the M.Sc. degree in Control Science and Engineering with School of Automation Science and Electrical Engineering, Beihang University, directed by Prof. Xiwang Dong and Prof. Zhang Ren. My research interests focus on motion planning for mobile robots, such as aerial robots and unmanned ground vehicles.
In June 2021, I received the B.Eng. degree in Automatic Control with an outstanding graduate award from Beihang University, Beijing, China.
summary: Hello! I am currently working toward the M.Sc. degree in Control Science and Engineering with School of Automation Science and Electrical Engineering, Beihang University, directed by Prof. Xiwang Dong and Prof.
title: Yicheng Chen

content:
News November 11, 2022. That’s it, this project is started! Project objectives This project aims to address the issue: How to enable agile flight for aerial robotics swarm in complex environments? The main considerations of this projects include:
Full autonomy: Fully onboard perception, localization, planning, and control. Online: Real-time flying in unknown environments. Cooperation: Multiple drones to perform cooperative tasks, such as search and rescue. Roadmap WP1: Trajectory parameterization
Parameterize trajectories in a spatial-temporal-decoupled form to support independent optimization on the spatial and temporal profile of the trajectory.
WP2: Distributed trajectory planning
Build an optimization framework considering control effort, execution time, dynamic feasibility, obstacle avoidance, and swarm reciprocal avoidance. And use gradient-based solvers to solve the problem.
WP3: Real-world experiments
Build quadrotors equipped with depth cameras, Intel NUC, and the Pixhawk controller to conduct real-world experiments.
summary: **Master's thesis (ongoing)** | This project tries to answer this question: How to navigate an aerial robotics swarm with autonomy, safety, and agility in complex environments?
title: Cooperative Online Trajectory Planning for Autonomous Aerial Robotics Swarm

content: At the conference CACRE 2022, I was honored the Best Presenter Award for an excellent oral presentation.
summary: An RRT-based path planning algorithm enables UAVs to replan safe paths when dynamic threats emerge.
title: Adaptively Dynamic RRT*-Connect: Path Planning for UAVs Against Dynamic Obstacles

summary: A novel multi-UAV mobile edge computing framework, aiming to provide better Quality-of-Service and path planning based on reinforcement learning.
title: Multi-UAV Mobile Edge Computing and Path Planning Platform Based on Reinforcement Learning

content:
Aim Use machine learning approaches to help preliminary diagnosis of chest radiographs: classify radiographs into 3 classes – COVID, normal, and viral pneumonia with the highest possible accuracy.
Method Used transfer learning to train several models including ResNet, DenseNet, InceptionResNet, etc. on a labeled training set. Used stacking to ensemble the above models to form a stronger model. Achievement Achieved accuracy of more than 0.98. Especially, the model achieved almost 100% precision in the COVID class.
Model performance on test set
summary: Use machine learning approaches to help preliminary diagnosis of chest radiographs: classify radiographs into 3 classes – COVID, normal, and viral pneumonia with the highest possible accuracy.
title: Radiograph Classification for Diagnosing COVID-19
